title: Old grotesk(s)
content:
A lot like AG, but with different g and t. The print is from 1966.   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018091629im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/38642.jpg)   
This is from 1928 and from the same press. Same family?   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018091629im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/38643.jpg)   
What are they?
author: ovaalk

comments.content:
Akkurat, recently released by Lineto, is not an exact match but has some of the flavor of this sample, too.   
   
 [http://www.lineto.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018091629/http:/www.lineto.com/)

Yes, FF Bau certainely comes closest with the wide caps and angled t-ascender, but still it has different ear of g and some proportions.   
   
I would like to see the original samples of Schelter & Giesecke grotesk.

Here is another sample from a 1963 print:   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018091629im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/38670.jpg)   
I found out that the t an k suddenly change in the 1928 book:   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018091629im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/38671.jpg)   
Now these two samples seem more like same family, but the r is still puzzling.

Oooh, lovely. I don't know what it is, but have you   
already taken a look at [FF Bau](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018091629/http:/www.philsfonts.com/showing.html?sku=FF011312X1P2&start=1)?   
   
BTW killer "a" and "g"!
